item.title: No road sweeping on Belmont Park, 26th June
item.description:
I reported this problem over a week ago and for some reason it did not identify as Belmont Hill but somewhere else which I do not recognise. This problem is outside the houses numbers 16 and 18 and still need clearing up

item.title: Parents writing on the wall of a property -, 26th June
item.description:
Following some arguments between families in the street regarding children's behaviour getting out of hand / becoming anti social, one of the parents wrote 'KID WILL BE KIDS' on the wall. although this may not seem offensive it is unsightly and also condones the behaviour of the children, which has previously got out of hand to the point where the police have been involved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gattons Way, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving defect at entrance to Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground, 26th June
item.description:
This morning we found the bollard at the entrance to Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground had been removed and the surrounding material had been broken up and scattered along the entrance way and into the carpark. We replaced the bollard and made a temporary repair to the surface by crushing and compacting the broken material. Please could the paving be repaired? Please note further report requesting nearby repairs to paving outside the entrance: https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/7769734

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bulky items left overnight, 26th June
item.description:
Bulky furniture items left in Priors Mead since 7 days. An individual in the council flat from 1 - 8 ( not sure which one) was seen leaving items there. Items were left on the curve at the entrance of Priors Mead, hidden behind a tree. Please act according to common sense, community respect and council este management guidelines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Mead, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Budlea weed dammaging river wall, 26th June
item.description:
These Budlea are weeds, obstructing views from the river and information boards and the roots are damaging the river wall

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Horseferry Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken and no dropped curb at entrance to Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground, 26th June
item.description:
Paving at the entrance to Hoblingwell Wood Recreation Ground is broken and uneven. Also, there is no dropped curb here which is a barrier to those with limited mobility, wheelchair users, pram/pushchair users, etc.. This presents a hazard to those entering the recreation ground at this point as it is on a busy bend in the road and at the entrance/exit where vehicles are accelerating, up the incline, on exiting. Please could this entrance be remade, to repair the broken paving and install a dropped curb with appropriate tactile paving, etc. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe and loose paving stones, 26th June
item.description:
In the small park on the corner of Highgate North Hill and Alma Road between and Shelton Avenue, the quite high-quality York stone paving is in quite a bad condition especially at the main road end and as the photo shows some of them stones are certainly projecting by more than 2 inches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylmer Road, Muswell Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on private property, 26th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington High Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Virgin Media cabinet open at top of Beechway, 26th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Beechway, Blendon, London
